intro: Asteromoea pekinensis, commonly known as the Peking asteromoea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue to purple in color, with a yellow center. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
